intro: Helianthus angustifolius subsp. ciliaris, commonly known as the narrowleaf sunflower, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that have hairy margins. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species within the Asteraceae family.
